channel.title: Changing starting outfit?
channel.description:
Hey Guys! I have been gone for a while, but now I am back to try to learn this language better than ever. So too start off I might need some help until I can start learning how to find everything.
My first question is how do I change the starting outfit on a czar source?
I am asking this because my Silab client isn't working so I have to use Webber's Cheat Client. So some of the models don't work on their and make my character invisible. So I need to be able to take the equipment off so my client doesn't crash everytime I click on equipment.
So far I know what I am looking for is either in "Player.java" or "PlayerHandler.java". I just don't know what to search. So if any of you can help me out that would be great!
Thanks!

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

I already got it Scape-Java.

Can you help me with this now?

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:9, topic:367721”]Lol Cyberman. I just did that befrore I read you quote. Thanks for the help though.

My next question is where could I find a client for czar or how can I make one. I am using a cheat client which is good for coding because it has all the ID numbers, but I don’t want to have to have other people using this to play on my server.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Oops, I failed I forgot to add ints to the code snippets, just add something like

-1

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Lol Cyberman. I just did that befrore I read you quote. Thanks for the help though.

My next question is where could I find a client for czar or how can I make one. I am using a cheat client which is good for coding because it has all the ID numbers, but I don’t want to have to have other people using this to play on my server.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You have to add numbers to Scape-JAVA’s snippet.

playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4151;

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Lol you need to do: playerEquipment[playerHat]=-1;

-1 means nothing

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Ok, I did it like you said and when I compiled I got eleven errors all pointing to the semi-colon. So I put a space in there and still got 11 errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

In player.java look for : playerEquipment[playerHat]= and you’ll see all the starter outfits to edit.

EDIT: Lol look above ^^ I was late.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

you should to something like,

playerEquipment[playerHat]=; playerEquipment[playerCape]=; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=; playerEquipment[playerChest]=; playerEquipment[playerShield]=; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=; playerEquipment[playerHands]=; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=; playerEquipment[playerRing]=; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=;

or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Sweet! I found it, but what numbers do I change them to so they have nothing on. Just like their character outfit.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting outfit?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

search initial

If you see initial x and y coordinates of the player scroll up and you should see your starting outfit info.

Read full topic
